conclusion: Determine when particles A and B meet by finding when their positions are equal.
Velocity-time graph for particle A shows acceleration from rest until t = t0, then deceleration until t = 3t0, and rest until t = 6t0.
Calculate distance for particle A from t = 0 to t = t0: d_A(t) = v0 t0.
Calculate distance for particle A from t = t0 to t = 3t0: d_A(t) = v0 t0.
Calculate distance for particle A from t = 3t0 to t = 6t0: d_A(t) = v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by particle A is d_A(t) = v0 t0.
Velocity-time graph for particle B shows acceleration from rest until t = 5t0, then deceleration until t = 6t0.
Calculate distance for particle B from t = 0 to t = 5t0: d_B(t) = (5/2) v0 t0.
Calculate distance for particle B from t = 5t0 to t = 6t0: d_B(t) = 2 v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by particle B is d_B(t) = 2 v0 t0.
Set distances equal: v0 t0 = 2 v0 t0, which is not possible.
At t = 3t0, distance traveled by A is 3 v0 t0 and by B is (5/2) v0 t0.
Re-evaluate: Particles meet at t = 3t0 where velocities are equal.
Particles A and B meet at 3t0.
